solution_line_template: If Fred has {fred_candy_bars} identical candy bars, uncle Bob has {fred_candy_bars}+{bob_more_than_fred}=<<{fred_candy_bars}+{bob_more_than_fred}={uncle_bob_candy_bars}>>{uncle_bob_candy_bars} candy bars.
Together, Fred and Uncle Bob have {fred_candy_bars}+{uncle_bob_candy_bars} = <<{fred_candy_bars}+{uncle_bob_candy_bars}={total_fred_bob_candy_bars}>>{total_fred_bob_candy_bars} candy bars.

Jacqueline has ten times the total number of candy bars Fred and Uncle Bob have, meaning she has {jacqueline_multiplier}*{total_fred_bob_candy_bars} = <<{jacqueline_multiplier}*{total_fred_bob_candy_bars}={jacqueline_candy_bars}>>{jacqueline_candy_bars} candy bars.
